No Poverty.reason: Week 6 explicitly focuses on poverty in development thought and vulnerabilities, making it a core element of the course.

Zero Hunger.reason: Week 10 covers agricultural development, land reform, and food security, linking the course directly to hunger and rural transformation.

Good Health and Well-being.reason: Health is mentioned indirectly through development, human satisfaction, and social transformation, but not as a primary focus.

Quality Education.reason: Week 11 includes 'Universities and Higher Education in Development,' showing relevance to education systems and their role in development.

Gender Equality.reason: Week 6 references 'Women’s Economic Roles and The Development Paradigm,' providing explicit but limited coverage.

Clean Water and Sanitation.reason: No substantial focus on water access or sanitation in the syllabus.

Affordable and Clean Energy.reason: Energy transition is not directly covered in the syllabus; development is framed more around trade, finance, agriculture, and governance.

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: Strong focus on economic growth, trade, finance, entrepreneurship, and employment in development contexts.

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: Week 11 directly covers industrial policy, innovation, ICT, and infrastructure in development strategies.

Reduced Inequalities.reason: Inequality is explicitly covered in Week 6, alongside poverty, making it a major focus of the course.

Sustainable Cities and Communities.reason: Urbanization and cities are not explicitly covered, though rural transformation and land reform have some indirect connections.

Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: No explicit discussion of consumption and production patterns, only indirect connections through agriculture and industrial policy.

Climate Action.reason: Environmental sustainability and climate are not central themes; only implicit links through agriculture, rural transformation, and development policy.

Life Below Water.reason: No mention of marine ecosystems or oceans.

Life on Land.reason: Land reform and rural transformation are directly discussed in Week 10, connecting the course to land-related development issues.

Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions.reason: Covers governance, state as developmental actor, democracy, civil society, and security in development, strongly aligned with SDG 16.

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: International organizations, aid, official development assistance, and multilateral institutions are central in Weeks 14–15, making SDG 17 highly relevant.
